title: Michael's Birthday
description: In celebration of his birthday, Michael makes a mandatory invite of the staff during the workday to go ice skating.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, Phil recruited me to sell these cards, and now I am recruiting you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Who is this guy again?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't worry about Phil. He drives a corvette. He is doing just fine. Okay. Calling cards are... the wave of the future. These things sell themselves.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Who uses calling cards anymore?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? That's a nice attitude, Ryan, I'm just helping you invest in your future, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This sounds like a get rich quick scheme.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes! Thank you! You will get rich quick. We all will!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Didn't you lose a lot of money on that other investment, the one from the email?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, Toby? When the son of the deposed king of Nigeria emails you directly, asking for help, you help! His father ran the freaking country, okay? ...Alright, so, raise your hand if you wanna get rich. [Jim and Dwight raise their hands] Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, um. How is this not a pyramid scheme?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, let me explain. Again. [draws on board] Phil has recruited me and another guy. Now, we are getting three people each. The more people that get involved, the more who are investing, the more money we're all going to make. It's not a pyramid scheme, it is a... it's not even a scheme per se, it's... [Jim draws a triangle around Michael's diagram] ... I have to go make a call.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Happy birthday Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh ho ho! What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I said happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you! That's really nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today is my B-day, and people around here just go crazy for it. I don't know why. Oh! Fun fact. I share my birthday with Eva Longoria. So, I have a perfect ice-breaker if I ever meet Terry Hatcher.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey. ...Oh, happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, thank you sir.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Did you hear anything yet?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No. I'm still waiting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Dwight knocks on door] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. There he is, the birthday boy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh, god.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Birthday hug!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No no no, no, new suit, please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That suit is amazing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you very much. It is from Italy. [checks jacket] Actually-- no, Bulgaria.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmm. Maybe I should get one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good luck. One of a kind.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ebay. Hm. Question! May I be in charge of the party planning festivities?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not necessary, the party planning committee is all over it.  They've been working twenty-four seven all day yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excellent. On my part, I did manage to reserve the...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't! Nope! Please, don't want to spoil it for anybody. Spoil the surprise.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's get the party started. [Begins 'raising the roof']

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's get the party started.  Not the way I taught you! [Michael joins in]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: When should we bring out the cake, one or one thirty?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: One's good.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: One thirty. [Pam yawns] I'm sorry, are we boring you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Party planning committee, listen up. Michael would like trick candles for his birthday cake, so make that a priority.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Where do we get those?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not my problem. Here is a list of things that Michael would like to be surprised by. [hands list to Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael wants a strippergram?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, but he doesn't want to know when, or whom.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. This is a closed door meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [answering phone] Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, I have Jan on the line.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, great, put her through.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hello, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I'm... returning your call, you said it was urgent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is urgent, I just wanted to call and wish you a happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, today's not my birthday, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? 'Cause, I thought we had the same birthday.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: ...Happy birthday, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks. [grins]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Am I on camera?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope. Totally private. You can say whatever is in your heart. [Jan hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Ryan, sitting across from Michael] ...You can take a five, if you want.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Somebody brought in donuts for my birthday!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Mmhmm, happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Man, I'm so sorry. When do you find out?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: They said this afternoon. They're waiting on a second opinion.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Second opinion on what?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Um, I might have skin cancer.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, no! I was watching Grey's Anatomy, and there was a lifeguard on it, and he had skin cancer too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kelly, you know what...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I never really thought about death until Princess Diana died. That was the saddest funeral ever. That and my sister's.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Who brought in donuts?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Somebody got donuts for my birthday!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Happy birthday!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You didn't know it was my birthday.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I... guess I forgot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I guess I forgot to give you a donut [closes box].

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Skin cancer is treatable.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's going to be okay.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You don't know it's going to be okay. Don't give him false hope. ...It's probably nothing, though.

quotes.speaker: Delivery Woman
quotes.text: Hi, delivery for Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go. Ohhhkay, this is great! [giggles] Thank you my friends, she is perfect! Ahhh, Dwight, may I have your chair please? And, um, some singles, if you will! Allllright. Nnnnn-dink! [puts single into delivery woman's pocket, giggles] Okay, um, alright. This has arms. Is that gonna be a... is that alright?

quotes.speaker: Delivery Woman
quotes.text: Uh... s-sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] Okay. I'm so nervous.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can sign for it.

quotes.speaker: Delivery Woman
quotes.text: Oh. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I was seven, my mother hired a pony and a cart to come to my house for all the kids... and... I got a really bad rash from the pony, and all the kids got to ride the pony and I had to go inside, and my mother was rubbing cream on me... for probably three hours, and I never came outside. And by the time I got out the pony was already in the truck. And around the corner. So that was my worst birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [eating donuts while Dwight plays the recorder] Stop it. Stop! What is that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's 'For the Longest Time,' by William Joel. It's you favorite song.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, it's on the radio. My birthday blows. Nobody even signed my birthday poster. Probably my mother is the only one that cares enough to send me anything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I probably care more than she does.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're making it worse. I bet Luke Perry's friends don't treat him like this [points to James Dean poster].

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When does he hear?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sometime today.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ohh... poor Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: If I knew I had a week to live, I would... probably go to Europe. And South America. And the Grand Canyon. And... I would want to see the Pacific Ocean. ...It would be a pretty busy week.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, that's a list price of four dollars and fifty cents.  Unfortunately, this item is on [watch beeps] back... order... [hangs up] Michael! Michael! Michael Michael Michael! Come here, come here, come here!  Come here!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen up everyone! It is 11:23 exactly, the exact moment when you emerged from your mother's vaginal canal, so... huh?! Right, have a seat. Please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [grinning] Ohhh, God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There is a tradition that the Hebrews have of hoisting the birthday boy up on a chair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohhh, no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So come help me celebrate Michael's birth moment. Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: ...I'll do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh, no, no, no! I can't... Ryan, come on. Let's do this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Creed! Come on. Stanley!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ...I feel like we should go get Kevin something. Do you think we can sneak out of here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe, but... we're gonna need somebody to create a diversion, and...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On three, we're going to hoist away! Ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Happy birth moment, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One. Two. Three! [Michael is raised until his head hits the ceiling]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa whoa! Alright. Alright. Watch it... please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oscar...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It wasn't me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, that is not an eight foot sub.

quotes.speaker: Delivery Boy
quotes.text: Uh, we don't make an eight foot sub. This is eight one foot subs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: F. Alright, what's the damage?

quotes.speaker: Delivery Boy
quotes.text: Uh, thirty-nine sixty.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [pulls out wallet] Thirty nine... sixty.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why tip someone for a job I'm capable of doing myself? I can deliver food. I can drive a taxi. I can, and do, cut my own hair. I did, however, tip my urologist, because... I am unable to pulverize my own kidney stones.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here they come.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get in here... everybody.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come and get it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Birthday party subs! My gift to you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, bologna, tomato and ketchup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The best.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: These are all the same?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Bologna? I don't eat bologna.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then just have the tomato and ketchup. Still good.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just the bread, it's fresh baked.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-kay. Get whatever you want. [under breath] And choke on it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I was sixteen, I was supposed to go out on a date with a girl named Julie. But there was another Michael in the class that she apparently thought the date was with, so she went out with him, on my birthday. And, she got him a cake, at the restaurant. And it wasn't even his birthday, but I heard about it the next day in school. So... That was the worst birthday I think I ever had.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So. We got Kev some stuff. Um... a party pack of M&M's, his favorite candy. A DVD of American Pie 2, which is his favorite movie, and, he lent it to Creed, so, I can guarantee you he won't get that back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sixty-nine cup of noodles.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which we realize sounds crass, but, it... is his favorite number.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And his favorite lunch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey temp, you know uh, we still got five feet of sandwich left [pulls ice cream cake out of freezer].

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [making peanut butter and jelly sandwich] Someone ate three feet of that thing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hell, yeah. Save room for ice cream cake.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [grabs cake] Oh. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh. I got it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What are-- it's... the party planning committee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering] This is the most important day of the year. I can't risk anything.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What about that meeting... later... to discuss finances?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes... [whispering] but don't expect any cookie.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering] But what if i'm hungry?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [whispering] No cookie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [puts fabric softener into cart] ...What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You use fabric softener?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, you don't?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: ...Okay.

quotes.speaker: Office Staff
quotes.text: [singing] Happy birthday dear Michael, [Michael joins in, Kevin's phone rings] Happy birthday... [everyone but Dwight stops] ...tooo youuuu.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hello? Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin? Respect the birthday please.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, um, no not yet. I will. Bye. [hangs up] It was just Stacy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you done? ...Good. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here we go. Make a wish.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uhhh... blow out the candle. Okay. Mmmm... [blows out the candles]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yaoo yay! [claps]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ... I asked for trick candles.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam was supposed to get 'em.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well, when she comes back we'll do it again. [notices Meredith hugging Kevin] Hello, what about the birthday boy? Haven't had a hug all day.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No one cares about your birthday. Kevin's waiting to hear if he has skin cancer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ... Aww, that... sucks, great. ... Wow, that's good timing. That's... that's, sorry, that's terrible. Terrible news. That's terrible... terrible news for both of us [takes cake into office and slams the door].

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [checking watch] We should probably head back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Okay. Oh. I dare you to make an announcement.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You dare me? How old are you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just... quit stalling.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [over loudspeaker, imitating Darth Vader] Luke, this is your father. Come set the table for dinner.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Such a dork.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [loudspeaker] Jim Halpert? Price check on fabric softener, the kind that gives you...

quotes.speaker: Store Employee
quotes.text: Ma'am? Please don't touch that. That is not a toy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh I'm sorry. I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How old are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I hate you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [to Kevin] Honestly, is there any way you can get on your fiancee's plan? Our health plan is s... just... it's terrible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There you are. Good news. Did some research. It turns out that 98% of people with skin cancer fully recover.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Still scary.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, but it's not brain cancer. And it shouldn't stop us from having fun. You know what they say the best medicine is.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well the doctor said a combination of interferon and dicarbazine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And laughter... also.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don't really think people are in the laughing mood.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why are you here? I didn't even invite you to my birthday party.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I work here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mocking voice] Nyeh, I work here. [to Kevin] Alright, well, you know what, since Toby doesn't speak for everybody and I am your boss, I... think you should just go home. Take the rest of the afternoon off. Take a sick day.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: If I go home now, I'll just drive myself crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you're pretty much driving everyone else here crazy... crazy with worry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where have you been? And don't say the bathroom, 'cause I kicked in all the stalls.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well that's an invasion of privacy, so, I'm going to tell Michael.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please, don't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You... owe me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excuse me, everyone. Attention please. Kevin, we're going to take you to a very special place, a place that will make you happy, and a place that is far, far away from the evil sun.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Is this trip related in any way to your... birthday?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How dare you sir. You are gross.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sees 'Happy Birthday Michael Scott!' poster at skating rink] That should not be there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll get someone to take it down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it's alright. It's already up. Just leave it. Where's Kevin? Come on! Let's get our skate on!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Don't be scared! You're good! You're good!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Think you can let go?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa. [Michael skates by]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: YEAH!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Who is that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I've been pretty much skating my whole life. I thought about playing in the NHL, but, you're on the road so much. You got no time to spend with your wife and kids. And I really want a wife and kids.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I got it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Pam, all this stuff with Kevin... um, it's pretty scary. And I'm thinking that uh, next time you're in the shower, you should check yourself out. You know, give yourself an exam. Those things are like ticking time bags. Alright? Think about it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: ...It's something to think about.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I can't relax about it, you know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin. You heard anything yet?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, not yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well. Live strong.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Carol? She sold me my condo! Hey! What, is this place on the market? Or...

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Uhh, no, I... don't just sell real estate. Uh, my daughter has a skating lesson.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, these... all your kids?

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: No just the front two.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey guys. Whats up? You wanna go for a ride? Is that okay?

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool. Alright. Grab on. Here we go. Ready? Hang on tight. Alright. We are moving. We are reaaallly mooovin' now!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Push. Good! That's great. You got it. [Kevin's phone rings] Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hello? Yeah okay. Alright. Okay, I will, thanks. [hangs up] It was negative.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh... God... [stomps] God! [throws hockey stick and yellow paper bracelet down] We're gonna beat this, okay? We're gonna... come here [hugs Kevin].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, apparently in the medicine community, negative means good. Which makes absolutely no sense. In the real world community, that would... be... chaos.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This is awesome. Thanks, you guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, who's this from? Wowwwee, look at that! Jersey!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Turn it around. Turn it around.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool. Ohh. Great. From Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Number one!!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you... Dwight. That's great. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is from all of us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! You didn't need to do that. ...Nightswept. This is... really amazing. Thank you. I love it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael's birthday was actually pretty cool. It was a good day. I don't know... It was a good day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael's birthday. It's pretty fun to watch, actually. He gets very excited, and then he eats a lot of cake. And then he runs around the office. Then he has a sugar crash in the afternoon. And then he falls asleep. And that's when we get our work done.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's get the party started.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not how I taught you, right? [singing] My hump, my hump, my lovely lady lump Check it out [Dwight imitating drumbeat]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael's birthday is hard for me because he gets very excited. But he's also under a lot of pressure, which builds up until he's ready to explode. As his right-hand man, it's my job to release that pressure so that he can enjoy himself, if only for a moment.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, here's the thing about bosses and employees. A good boss will say, "Hey, it's my birthday. Celebrate me." A great boss will say, "Hey, it's my birthday. Celebrate yourselves, because you are the ones who made me great, and I will acknowledge your contributions with donuts."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. You know, Ryan, you didn't have to get me a present.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I won't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Great.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, good. I think I'm gonna go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I think you're gonna stay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On my 20th birthday, my supposed best friend, Sam Ambrose, ditched me for his twin sister's Sweet Sixteen party. And that was my worst birthday. Until today.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Can you please stop staring at me? [Dwight continues to stare and then walks away]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: To think that a man's skin could turn on him. It's brilliant, 'cause you'd never expect it. Most people think of their skin as an ally. [scoffs] Makes me rethink having skin at all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knock on door] Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey. I got the information.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, good. Okay. Don't tell me, tell them.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [turns to camera] "The survival rate for localized melanoma is 98%."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God. That's a piece of cake. That's a piece of cake. Oh, 2%. Jeez, that's good.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [looking at camera] "There was 7,800 deaths from melanoma in 2005."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Out of, like, 18 billion Americans, so, no worry.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: "For localized melanoma, the five-year survival rate is 98%. The survival rates for regional and..."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Those were probably misdiagnosed. I mean, anybody with a zit goes in and says, "I have cancer."

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: "The skin is the largest organ of the body."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Untrue. The heart is bigger than the skin. If you stretched the heart out, it would cover more than the entire body.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm not afraid of dying. I know where I'm going. But if I were Kevin, I might be terrified. Gluttony.
